sub_title: I write about systems, lifestyle design, and peak performance | PhD Candidate | Keynote Speaker
summary:
➤Born and raised in Pakistan, graduated from Singapore, and studying and working in Europe, I am on a mission to contribute towards a more sustainable and inclusive world. 

➤Currently, I am a doctoral researcher at the Eindhoven University of Technology, trying to uncover how the governance of current energy systems can transition into more collaborative and regional forms in the future. I also speak, consult and advocate on climate change and open science, and write about peak performance.

➤Previously, I have; completed a double degree master in Sustainable Energy and a bachelor in mechanical engineering; taught at a high school; taken a sabbatical of 8 months to travel around Asia to discover my passions; and worked as a mechanical engineer in the transport sector.  

➤I am a big believer of lifelong self-development, continuous learning, welcoming change, and empowering others for the same. I also routinely obsess over politics, history, culture, adventure traveling, big tech, stocks, cricket, and coffee. 

If any of the above sounds interesting, let's connect and have a nice cup of coffee?

projects.title: Energy Outlook and Human Development: An outlook to Africa's situation and perspectives.
projects.description:
This project explored the energy outlook and its relationship with human development for 10 African countries with the lowest electricity access ratios namely: Burundi and South Sudan in East Africa; Central African Republic, Chad, and Democratic Republic of Congo in Central Africa; Guinea-Bissau, Liberia, Niger, Sierra Leone in West Africa; and Malawi in South Africa.

The two main objectives of this project were:
1) Identify and investigate key parameters for energy access and their link with human development for the ten African countries.
2) Propose solutions, evaluate their feasibility and link with human development as an added value for the United Nations Energy Access Facility (UN-EAF) to improve energy access and human development in the ten African countries.

projects.title: Energy Harvesting from Bodily Motions
projects.description:
Energy Harvesting from Bodily Motions; Vibration Theory and Application Project
Led an individual project to conduct feasibility analysis of harnessing energy from human bodily motions. This involved conducting experiments, research, and analysis to prepare a report on energy harvesting methodologies and their application in potential sustainable technologies including energy harvesting backpack, piezoelectric stack, knee-joint energy harvester and power-generating shoes.

contributors.headline: I write about systems, lifestyle design, and peak performance | PhD Candidate | Keynote Speaker

projects.title: The Electric Arc - Classic Sports Car Conversion
projects.description:
• Founding member of the ECat-7 team to convert the Caterham 7 into a fully electric car under a 3.5 yearlong project.
• Studied literature reviews, carried-out research, drafted reports and delivered presentations on the project concept, feasibility analysis and conversion methods for the transformation of Caterham-7 into a fully electric car (including hybrid-electric, plug-in hybrid, battery electric, and extended-range electric vehicles).
• Conducted research (including literature reviews), design and experimentation to develop the complete thermal management and power generation system (including traditional EV batteries, fuel-cells and ultracapacitors). This included writing reports and delivering presentations on the aforementioned topics
• The fully electric converted car was selected to be showcased at the World Engineers’ Summit on Climate Change 2015.

profile_positions.description:
Experimental Governance for Regional Energy Transition
The energy transition towards renewable energy changes our landscapes, but will also affect the social organization of the energy system. Who will benefit and how can we organize the participation of citizens? This project gives insight into the successful participation projects and provides governments with tools to test new governance models
profile_positions.title: Doctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
ReCell aims to develop a cross-border environomically optimised end-of-life strategy for Europe's Li-ion battery value chain. 

My role includes:
▪Policy analysis of the EU battery directive and national-level laws to isolate shortcomings and identify areas of improvement. 
▪Organizing interviews and mapping stakeholders for academic/professional collaboration and establishing best practices in the industry. 
▪Developing a plan for business opportunities within the EU lithium-ion value chain.  
▪Authoring and publishing regular reports about the project's progress
▪Marketing and dissemination of ReCell's activities.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
Conducted industry and policy research on recycling and reusing of lithium-ion batteries. 
Contributing author and peer reviewer of Global EV Outlook 2020.
profile_positions.title: Research Consultant

profile_positions.description: Conducted a life-cycle assessment and circularity analysis of Solar Urban hub - an integrated energy and information system that combines advanced solar photovoltaic technology with lithium-polymer batteries, lighting technology, and remote monitoring technology ​for Smart Cities. The project involved data collection & analysis, carbon footprint analysis, life-cycle impact assessment and a circularity analysis ( based on material circularity indicator developed by Ellen McArthur Foundation).
profile_positions.title: Research Consultant

profile_positions.description:
• Developed a proposal for an energy aggregator in Spain based on residential and commercial demand response together with Estabnell Energia, Spain and Sweco, Sweden.
• Conducted a benchmarking exercise to analyze the business models of different European aggregators and identify synergies with the electricity system of Spain together with building the operating model and minimum viable products.

profile_positions.description:
CORE:
▪Developing FMECA for Pneumatic, Door and Bogie Systems as part of SERAMS (System/Equipment Reliability, Availability Maintainability, and Safety) and the ISO 55001Audit Certification. 
▪Defect-trend analysis and monitoring of the aforementioned systems – Fault Tree Analysis (FTA) and Root-cause analysis (RCA) 
▪Engineering modification works and enhancement programs for train defects. 
▪Periodic reviewing and amendment of maintenance practices and procedures to ensure compliance with OEM instructions. 
▪Engineering studies and technical feasibility analysis for rectification, modification and improvement works for Rolling Stock.
▪Engaging Suppliers, evaluating their proposals/tenders and submitting recommendations for upgrading projects. 
▪Leading the technical officers in the implementation of the aforementioned modification/improvement works. 
▪Evaluating supplier proposals and participating in group discussion regarding on-board and track-side condition monitoring system for Train Doors, Wheels, Axles and Axle Bearings. 
▪Implementation of RFID system for train tagging, identification, asset management and the aforementioned condition monitoring system. 

NON-CORE/CCAs:
▪Committee Secretariat and Principal Liaison for Company’s Dinner and Dance 2015 for 4000+ people. 
▪Committee Secretariat and Principal Liaison for Long Service Award Ceremonies 2015. 
▪Organized RSE FY16 workplan retreat 2014.

▪Organizing Committee for CNY Senior Management Luncheon 2015.
▪Member of the Crowd-Control Team for Christmas Eve.
▪Member of Red Teaming Exercises at Depot and Train Stations.
▪Member of the Project Team for “Developing group-based KPIs to encourage team work” that secured the first-place.

volunteer_experiences.description: Volunteered as a Graphic Designer for helpfulETH. helpfulETH is an emergency research-initiative, which aims to provide short-term engineering solutions for needs in the healthcare sector caused through the COVID-19 epidemic situation.
